results.title: Le Silence de la Mer = the Silence of the Sea
results.brief_description:
During the Occupation, a German officer, who is also musician and an intellectual, is billeted in the countryside in the home of an old French farmer and his niece. They have sworn never to speak to the invader and listen in silence as the German pours out his ideas about music, the war and his love of France. I wanted to attempt a language composed entirely of images and sounds, and from which movement and action would be more or less banished”, said director Jean-Pierre Melville. See also: ‘Tu n’as rien vu a Hiroshima’[X000658], episode 10 of ‘Histoire du Cinema Francais’, contains an interview with Jean-Pierre Melville in which he explains how he had to film ‘Le silence de la mer’ outisde the strict control of the CNC (Centre National de la Cinematographie) and why he sought the approval of the French Resistance Movement before releasing this work. See also: Jean-Pierre Melville Cineaste (X001808, 16mm).

Credits: Producer, Marcel Cartier ; director, Jean-Pierre Melville ; writer, Jean-Pierre Melville ; photography, Henri Decae ; music, Edgar Bischoff.
Cast: Howard Vernon, Nicole Stephane, Jean-Marie Robain.

results.title: Le Fantome de la Liberte = The Phantom of Liberty
results.brief_description:
A series of casually linked episodes moving from Toledo in 1808 and Goya’s painting of ‘The executions of 3 May’ to contemporary Paris where various people try to grasp or shun, in Karl Marx’s phrase, ‘the phantom of liberty’. This is Bunuel’s very personal version of ‘La Ronde’. In eight sketches - each representing a different aspect of hypocrisy - he creates a succession of dazzling moments. The sketches use every type of comedy: there is an interval of French farce with slamming bedroom doors, two black jokes about cancer and mass murder and a piece of pure Ionesco. Each sketch has its point to make and its own authority figures to be lampooned. This is a delightful and hilarious Bunuelian masterpiece.

Credits: Producer: Serge Silberman ; director, Luis Bunuel ; writers, Luis Bunuel, Jean-Claude Carriere ; photography, Edmond Richard.
Cast: Adriana Asti, Julien Bertheau, Michel Piccoli, Adolfo Celi, Milena Vukotic, Jean-Claude Brialy, Monica Vitti, Muni, Paul Frankeur, Michel Lonsdale, Pierre Maguelon, Framcois Maistre, Helene Perdriere, Claude Pieplu, Jean Rochefort, Bernard Verle

results.title: Messieurs les Ronds de Cuir = The Pencil Pushers (TV Version)
results.brief_description:
This adaptation of Courteline revolves around a group of public servants working in a Ministry. Boring routine, mental inflexibility, narrowmindness: all the low points of human nature in general, and public administration in particular are being finely observed and satirised.

Credits: Director, writer, Daniel Ceccaldi ; music, Georges Delerue.
Cast: Raymond Pellegrin, Daniel Ceccaldi, Evelyne Buyle, Roger Carel, Raymond Armontel, Bernard Lecoq, Claude Dauphin.

results.title: Adieu Bonaparte = Al-Wedaa Ya Bonaparte
results.creator_credit: Youssef Chahine, Humbert Balsan, Jean-Pierre Mahot and Marianne Khoury
results.brief_description:
The experiences of an Egyptian family during the occupation of Alexandria by Napoleon and his army, and the uneasy friendship between a young Egyptian poet and one of Bonaparte’s advisers.

Credits: Producer, Jean-Pierre Mahot, Marianne Khoury, Humbert Balsan ; director, Youssef Chahine ; writers, Youssef Chahine, Jean-Michel Comet, Mohsen Mohiedine, Youry Nasrallah ; photography, Moshen Nasr ; music, Gabriel Yared.
Cast: Michel Piccoli, Patrice Chereau, Moshen Mohiedine, Moshena Tewfik.

results.title: Rude Journee Pour la Reine = Rough Day for the Queen
results.brief_description:
A day in the life of an ordinary family: Jeanne works as a cleaning lady, Albert is a night watchman. Julien, their son is arrested. At his release, his attempts to establish contact with his girlfriend Annie are thwarted by her parents who oppose the relationship. Departing from her usual role of victim and servant, Jeanne decides to plot to reunite the two lovers. To achieve this, she resorts to a secret weapon: her vivid imagination and her Walter Mitty-like fantasies of being a queen.

Credits: Producer, Yves Gasser ; director, Rene Allio ; writers, Gerard Chartreux, Janine Peyre ; photography, Denys Clerval ; music, Philippe Arthuys.
Cast: Simone Signoret, Jacques Debary, Olivier Perrier, Orane Demazis, Christiane Rorato, Gerard Depardieu.

results.title: La Voie Lactee = the Milky Way
results.brief_description:
Pierre and Jean journey to a holy shrine in Northern Spain (Santiago de Compostella). Are they pilgrims or tramps? No one knows their identity or their true motives. During this timeless intitiatic journey, their faith is severely tested by some of the irreverent characters they confront in the course of their pilgrimage. Even chance meetings with Jesus Christ, the Virgin Mary and the Devil are not quite what Pierre and Jean have been prepared for in their religious training. This late Bunuel film is one of his most direct treatment of the Catholic Church and the six central mysteries of Catholic dogma: the nature of God, Christ, the Virgin Mary, the Eucharist, divine grace and evil.

Credits: Producer, Serge Silberman ; director, Luis Bunuel ; writers, Luis Bunuel, Jean-Claude Carriere ; photography, Christian Matras ; music, Luis Bunuel.
Cast: Delphine Seyrig, Laurent Terzieff, Ellen Bahl, Paul Frankeur, Agnes Capri, Julien Berthau, Augusta Carriere, Julien Guiomar, Muni, Georges Marchal.

results.title: Un Grand Patron
results.brief_description:
Doctor Delage is so dedicated to his work that he is out of tune with everything else, including wife, family and assistants. Through his encounter with a young orphan he is soon drawn to reassess his values and priorities in life and to rediscover is humanity.

Credits: Producer, Andre Paulve ; director, Yves Ciampi ; writers, Pierre Very, Yves Ciampi ; photography, Marcel Grignon ; Joseph Kosma.
Cast: Pierre Fresnay, Renee Devillers, Jean-Claude Pascal, Claire duhamel, Maurice Ronet, Claude Nicot.

results.title: Les Zozos = the Deceivers
results.creator_credit: Pascal Thomas and Albina du Boisrouvray
results.brief_description:
In 1962, two teenage boys spend their weeks in a boarding school in a provincial town. They horse around, playing pranks, roughhousing with each other and climbing over the school’s walls to harass and tease the local girls. Their main interest in life is women; anything to do with them is pleasing to them. They scrape together the money for a trip to Sweden, and despite more difficulties than they anticipated, one of them succeeds in making love with a girl.

Credits: Producer, Albina du Boisrouvray ; director, Pascal Thomas ; writers, Pascal Thomas, Roland Duval ; photography, Colin Mounier ; music, Vladimir Cosma.
Cast: Frederic Duru, Edmond Raillard, Jean-Marc Chollet, Daniel Ceccaldi, Serge Rousseau, Jacques Debary, Virginie Thevenet.

results.title: Partenaires = Partners
results.brief_description:
Marion is a famous actress of the popular theatre who owes her success to her husband, Gabriel, a bitter and alcoholic has-been. This unbalance in their respective fortune is driving their relationship to an end. Everynight, in the changing rooms of the theatre, the two actors engage in a cruel verbal and emotional ‘duel’.

Credits: Producer, Henry Lange ; director, Claude d’Anna ; writers, Laure Bonin, Claude d’Anna ; photography, Pierre Dupouey ; music, Richard Henberger, Egisto Macchi.
Cast: Nicole Garcia, Jean-Pierre Marielle, Michel Galabru, Michel Duchaussoy, Elisa Servier, Jenny Cleves.

results.title: La Guerre Est Finie = the War Is Over
results.creator_credit: Alain Resnais, Europa Films and Sofracima
results.brief_description:
Diego has spent his life working for a revolutionary group still fighting the battles of 1936 in a Spain that no longer exists. Living in Paris Diego makes repeated trips to Spain to work for the cause. Through his close collaboration with Jorge Semprun, the Spanish novelist then in exile, Resnais constructs the tragedy of a man who has come to question the very thing that has defined the value of his existence. He is bound to continue ‘the war’ but for him it is now more personal than political. Diego’s relationships with two women represent the myth and reality of his political life. The rhythms of the film are harnessed to Diego’s subjectivity - the memories, imaginings and connections in his mind together with moments of profound feeling. Also available on VHS (NLA #2081353).

Credits: Director, Alain Resnais ; writer, Jorge Semprun ; photography, Sacha Vierny ; music, Giovanni Fusco ; editor, Eric Pluet.
Cast: Yves Montand, Ingrid Thulin, Genevieve Bujold, Jean Bouise, Antoine Vitez, Gerard Lartigau, Bernard Fresson.
